documentInfo.title: ClubSwan50 Class Rules
documentInfo.manufacturer: Nautor Holdings SRL (Copyright Holder), Oy Nautor Ab (Builder)

additional.classType: strict ONE DESIGN class for OWNER DRIVER RACING only

hull.name: Hull
hull.manufacturer: Oy Nautor Ab and its suppliers

specifications.compliance: manufacturer controlled and certified; comply with ClubSwan50 Building Specification

subComponents.name: Keel
subComponents.manufacturer: Oy Nautor Ab and its suppliers

specifications.compliance: manufacturer controlled and certified; comply with ClubSwan50 Building Specification

subComponents.name: Rudder
subComponents.manufacturer: Oy Nautor Ab and its suppliers

specifications.compliance: manufacturer controlled and certified; comply with ClubSwan50 Building Specification
as specified in the building specification

specifications.purpose: to protect the surface finish in the proximity of moving deck hardware
specifications.functionality: shall not alter the function of the fitting nor modify the sheeting angle of any sail when loaded

specifications.certification: Every sail shall carry a CS50 sail card attached as specified in rule C.10 (CS50 approved sail)

specifications.installation: may be installed as specified in Appendix J

specifications.purpose: to protect or clear the spinnaker or headsail on drops or manoeuvres
specifications.installation: may be added to the lifelines
may be fitted to the lifelines

specifications.notes: Both are treated the same with regards to class controls and all measurements and considered as the Base Boat.

specifications.removable: Cabin and shower compartment doors may be removed
specifications.notRemovable: The toilet door is not removable

specifications.movable: may be moved for protection to under the Owner’s cabin berth

specifications.replaceable: may be replaced with alternatives supplied by ONA

specifications.installation: may be applied to interior surfaces

specifications.level: shall be maintained at minimum service levels as specified in the building specification

parts.name: Hull
parts.manufacturer: Oy Nautor Ab and its suppliers

specifications.compliance: manufacturer controlled and certified; comply with ClubSwan50 Building Specification
specifications.alterationLimits: only altered to the extent permitted in Section C of the class rules

parts.name: Hull Appendages
parts.manufacturer: Oy Nautor Ab and its suppliers

specifications.compliance: manufacturer controlled and certified; comply with ClubSwan50 Building Specification
specifications.alterationLimits: only altered to the extent permitted in Section C of the class rules

parts.name: Rig
parts.manufacturer: Oy Nautor Ab and its suppliers

specifications.compliance: manufacturer controlled and certified; comply with ClubSwan50 Building Specification
specifications.alterationLimits: only altered to the extent permitted in Section C of the class rules

specifications.includedInMeasurementCondition: Yes, with all components specified in the building specification and corrector weights
Yes, with all components specified in the building specification and corrector weights
Yes, with all components specified in the building specification and corrector weights
Yes, as specified in Appendix D
specifications.notIncludedInMeasurementCondition: Running rigging not specified in Appendix D

specifications.location1: permanently fastened forward of Bulkhead B and aft of Bulkhead F
specifications.distribution1: equally between the corrector weight locations to achieve a weight of 8150kg
specifications.location2: permanently fastened between Bulkhead C & D and aft of Bulkhead E
specifications.distribution2: equally between these corrector weight locations to achieve a minimum weight of 8180kg
specifications.marking: permanently marked by the official measurer after fixing
specifications.adjustment: only by the 50CA after measurement in measurement condition has been repeated following a significant repair or alteration
specifications.removalRestriction: once installed shall not be removed or moved unless by the 50CA

specifications.type: off the shelf / production articles (no custom or modified items)
specifications.portable: portable safety equipment not included in measurement condition

specifications.buildingSpecificationCompliance: required to comply with the ClubSwan50 Building Specification
specifications.manufacturingControlSystem: may be subject to a ClubSwan 50 approved manufacturing control system
specifications.modificationsPermitted: only by an amendment to the class rule or with prior approval of the 50CA
specifications.configurations: available in two basic configurations (2 cabin or 3 cabin)

specifications.description: the boat as described and detailed in associated documentation that defines the design, construction, assembly and quality control as approved by the 50CA
the quality assurance documents that have been completed as required by the 50CA during the construction and assembly of that specific CS50 boat

specifications.removal: may be removed for the purpose of all class measurements, equipment inspection and whilst racing
specifications.restriction: If included for the purpose of Class Measurement and recorded on the Class Certificate they are not permitted to be removed or modified whilst racing.

specifications.requirement: shall remain on board for the purposes of all class measurements, equipment inspection and whilst racing

maintenance.method: All maintenance shall be carried out in a way that the boat is retained in the original condition as when first launched, unless changes are made as a result of an amendment to the class rules.

Repairs may only be carried out by parties approved by NH. Owner shall inform 50CA immediately for action determination. Temporary repairs may be carried out during an event if no 50CA representative is available.

All boats racing in CS50 OD events shall carry out a yearly single point weight check prior to the mid-year CS50 event in which they have entered that calendar year. Always prior to a CS50 World Championship.

analysisResult.reason: The document is a yacht class rule manual, providing specific information about the ClubSwan 50 yacht, its components, rules, and some specifications. While not a typical owner's manual with detailed system breakdowns, it contains significant structured data relevant to the yacht's characteristics and regulations.
